item.description:
Ipswich River, Mass Audubon’s largest sanctuary, offers more than 10 miles of interconnecting trails that invite you to explore the forests, meadows, and wetlands. Unfortunately no dogs because it is a sanctuary. We often see deer and always lots of birds.

We will walk about 2 ½ to 3 hours at a brisk pace. Folks who want a shorter walk can turn back on many of the side trails. This is a lovely place. Meet in parking lot. There is a small entrance fee that you pay inside the office. Admission: $4 for nonmember adults; $3 for nonmember children (2-12) and seniors

Here are 2 links one for info and one for directions
http://www.massaudubo...
http://www.massaudubo...

Weather. com says: Morning clouds followed by afternoon sun - High 65 degrees

I have NO internet access after 3pm on Friday - My cell is 978-269-4232

group.name: North Shore Not Too Intense Hikers

item.name: Hike-Saturday - Ipswich River Audubon - Topsfield
